data.title: Their Imperial Highnesses Prince and Princess Tomohito of Mikasa
data.text:
His Imperial Highness Prince Tomohito of Mikasa passed away on 6 June 2012.

His Imperial Highness Prince Tomohito of Mikasa

Name

Tomohito

Lineage

Eldest Son of Prince Mikasa

Date of Birth

5 January 1946

Coming of Age Ceremony

5 January 1966 (at the age of 20)

Honorary Positions

President of the Social Welfare Organization Yuai Jyuji Kai

President of the Arinomama-sha

President of the Social Welfare Organization "saiseikai" Imperial Gift Foundation Inc.

President of the New Technology Development Foundation

President of the Princess Takamatsu Cancer Research Fund

President of the Nippon Billiard Association

President of the Professional Ski Instructors Association of Japan

President of the Collegiate Skating And Ice Hockey Federation

President of the Japan-Turkey Society

President of the Middle Eastern Culture Center in Japan

Honorary President of the Japan Rugby Football Union

Honorary President of the Japan-British Society

Honorary President of the Norway-Japan Society

Education

1968 - Graduated from the Department of Political Studies in the Faculty of Law of Gakushuin University

1968-1970 - Studied at Magdalen College, University of Oxford, UK

1970-1972 - Served as a committee member on the organizing committee for the Sapporo Winter Olympics.

1975 - Served as a member of the secretariat for the Okinawa International Marine Exhibition and Overseas Marine Youth Meeting.

Her Imperial Highness Princess Tomohito of Mikasa

Name

Nobuko

Lineage

Third Daughter of the late Takakichi Aso

Date of Birth

9 April 1955

Honorary Positions

President of the Tokyo Jikeikai

Honorary President of the Japan Rose Society

Honorary Vice-President of the Japanese Red Cross Society

Education

1973 - Graduated from Rosslyn House College, UK

Marriage

Imperial House Council

18 April 1980

Engagement Ceremony (Nosai no Gi)

21 May 1980

Marriage

7 November 1980
